pros: Good, smart people, there is room for upward mobility if you voice your ambition and network with the right people, opportunity for travel if you want, opportunity to work remote, family comes first attitude, good benefits, industry is dynamic, ever-changing, and growing, Some (not all) managers were really good and really wanted to help you succeed.
cons:
Long hours for inside sales and operations during quarter ends and year ends. Work/life balance depends on your position and team. Avnet only does as well as their distributors are doing, and the TS industry has been struggling mightily - which means we were always chasing unreachable targets, lay offs happen at least every other year, if not more. A lot of people do the minimum, Management is more worried about the numbers than the people, this made it a constant struggle to keep up quarter after quarter.
Advice to Management
Value your top performers and people who have bright futures more than you value the bottom line - it will pay off in the long run. Your people are what set you apart from your competitors, and if you don't take care of your people, you won't keep them around. Mentor, challenge, and look out for your young, high performers - otherwise they will leave you in the dust or become complacent. I was there for 3 years, and some of the best performers on my team left to work at resellers or competitors.
